camel.source.endpoint.amazonS3Client.name: camel.source.endpoint.amazonS3Client
camel.source.endpoint.amazonS3Client.description: Reference to a com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3 in the registry.

camel.source.endpoint.autoCreateBucket.name: camel.source.endpoint.autoCreateBucket
camel.source.endpoint.autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the bucket

camel.source.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.name: camel.source.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient
camel.source.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking.

camel.source.endpoint.pathStyleAccess.name: camel.source.endpoint.pathStyleAccess
camel.source.endpoint.pathStyleAccess.description: Whether or not the S3 client should use path style access

camel.source.endpoint.policy.name: camel.source.endpoint.policy
camel.source.endpoint.policy.description: The policy for this queue to set in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3#setBucketPolicy() method.

camel.source.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.source.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.source.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the S3 client

camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.source.endpoint.proxyPort.description: Specify a proxy port to be used inside the client definition.

camel.source.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.source.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.source.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the S3 client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.source.endpoint.region.name: camel.source.endpoint.region
camel.source.endpoint.region.description: The region in which S3 client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the capitalized name of the region (for example AP_EAST_1) You'll need to use the name Regions.EU_WEST_1.name()

camel.source.endpoint.useIAMCredentials.name: camel.source.endpoint.useIAMCredentials
camel.source.endpoint.useIAMCredentials.description: Set whether the S3 client should expect to load credentials on an EC2 instance or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.source.endpoint.encryptionMaterial.name: camel.source.endpoint.encryptionMaterials
camel.source.endpoint.encryptionMaterial.description: The encryption materials to use in case of Symmetric/Asymmetric client usage

camel.source.endpoint.useEncryption.name: camel.source.endpoint.useEncryption
camel.source.endpoint.useEncryption.description: Define if encryption must be used or not

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.deleteAfterRead.name: camel.source.endpoint.deleteAfterRead
camel.source.endpoint.deleteAfterRead.description: Delete objects from S3 after they have been retrieved. The delete is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not deleted. If this option is false, then the same objects will be retrieve over and over again on the polls. Therefore you need to use the Idempotent Consumer EIP in the route to filter out duplicates. You can filter using the S3Constants#BUCKET_NAME and S3Constants#KEY headers, or only the S3Constants#KEY header.

camel.source.endpoint.delimiter.name: camel.source.endpoint.delimiter
camel.source.endpoint.delimiter.description: The delimiter which is used in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

camel.source.endpoint.fileName.name: camel.source.endpoint.fileName
camel.source.endpoint.fileName.description: To get the object from the bucket with the given file name

camel.source.endpoint.includeBody.name: camel.source.endpoint.includeBody
camel.source.endpoint.includeBody.description: If it is true, the exchange body will be set to a stream to the contents of the file. If false, the headers will be set with the S3 object metadata, but the body will be null. This option is strongly related to autocloseBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the S3Object stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the S3Object stream automatically.

camel.source.endpoint.maxConnections.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxConnections
camel.source.endpoint.maxConnections.description: Set the maxConnections parameter in the S3 client configuration

camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll
camel.source.endpoint.maxMessagesPerPoll.description: Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. The default value is 10. Use 0 or a negative number to set it as unlimited.

camel.source.endpoint.prefix.name: camel.source.endpoint.prefix
camel.source.endpoint.prefix.description: The prefix which is used in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.name: camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
camel.source.endpoint.sendEmptyMessageWh.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files, you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

camel.source.endpoint.autocloseBody.name: camel.source.endpoint.autocloseBody
camel.source.endpoint.autocloseBody.description: If this option is true and includeBody is true, then the S3Object.close() method will be called on exchange completion. This option is strongly related to includeBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the S3Object stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the S3Object stream automatically.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.name: camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy
camel.source.endpoint.pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

camel.source.endpoint.accelerateModeEnab.name: camel.source.endpoint.accelerateModeEnabled
camel.source.endpoint.accelerateModeEnab.description: Define if Accelerate Mode enabled is true or false

camel.source.endpoint.chunkedEncodingDis.name: camel.source.endpoint.chunkedEncodingDisabled
camel.source.endpoint.chunkedEncodingDis.description: Define if disabled Chunked Encoding is true or false

camel.source.endpoint.dualstackEnabled.name: camel.source.endpoint.dualstackEnabled
camel.source.endpoint.dualstackEnabled.description: Define if Dualstack enabled is true or false

camel.source.endpoint.forceGlobalBucketA.name: camel.source.endpoint.forceGlobalBucketAccessEnabled
camel.source.endpoint.forceGlobalBucketA.description: Define if Force Global Bucket Access enabled is true or false

camel.source.endpoint.payloadSigningEnab.name: camel.source.endpoint.payloadSigningEnabled
camel.source.endpoint.payloadSigningEnab.description: Define if Payload Signing enabled is true or false

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffErrorThresh.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThreshold
camel.source.endpoint.backoffIdleThresho.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.name: camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier
camel.source.endpoint.backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

camel.source.endpoint.greedy.name: camel.source.endpoint.greedy
camel.source.endpoint.greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay
camel.source.endpoint.initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount
camel.source.endpoint.repeatCount.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1, the scheduler will only fire once. If you set it to 5, it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.name: camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel
camel.source.endpoint.runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that. One of: [TRACE] [DEBUG] [INFO] [WARN] [ERROR] [OFF]

camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorService
camel.source.endpoint.scheduledExecutorS.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.scheduler
camel.source.endpoint.scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz component. Use value spring or quartz for built in scheduler

camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.name: camel.source.endpoint.schedulerProperties
camel.source.endpoint.schedulerPropertie.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz, Spring based scheduler.

camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.name: camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler
camel.source.endpoint.startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit
camel.source.endpoint.timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options. One of: [NANOSECONDS] [MICROSECONDS] [MILLISECONDS] [SECONDS] [MINUTES] [HOURS] [DAYS]

camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.name: camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay
camel.source.endpoint.useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

camel.component.aws-s3.amazonS3Client.name: camel.component.aws-s3.amazonS3Client
camel.component.aws-s3.amazonS3Client.description: Reference to a com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3 in the registry.

camel.component.aws-s3.autoCreateBucket.name: camel.component.aws-s3.autoCreateBucket
camel.component.aws-s3.autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the bucket

camel.component.aws-s3.autoDiscoverClien.name: camel.component.aws-s3.autoDiscoverClient
camel.component.aws-s3.autoDiscoverClien.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking.

camel.component.aws-s3.pathStyleAccess.name: camel.component.aws-s3.pathStyleAccess
camel.component.aws-s3.pathStyleAccess.description: Whether or not the S3 client should use path style access

camel.component.aws-s3.policy.name: camel.component.aws-s3.policy
camel.component.aws-s3.policy.description: The policy for this queue to set in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3#setBucketPolicy() method.

camel.component.aws-s3.proxyHost.name: camel.component.aws-s3.proxyHost
camel.component.aws-s3.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the S3 client

camel.component.aws-s3.proxyPort.name: camel.component.aws-s3.proxyPort
camel.component.aws-s3.proxyPort.description: Specify a proxy port to be used inside the client definition.

camel.component.aws-s3.proxyProtocol.name: camel.component.aws-s3.proxyProtocol
camel.component.aws-s3.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the S3 client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.component.aws-s3.region.name: camel.component.aws-s3.region
camel.component.aws-s3.region.description: The region in which S3 client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the capitalized name of the region (for example AP_EAST_1) You'll need to use the name Regions.EU_WEST_1.name()

camel.component.aws-s3.useIAMCredentials.name: camel.component.aws-s3.useIAMCredentials
camel.component.aws-s3.useIAMCredentials.description: Set whether the S3 client should expect to load credentials on an EC2 instance or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.component.aws-s3.encryptionMateria.name: camel.component.aws-s3.encryptionMaterials
camel.component.aws-s3.encryptionMateria.description: The encryption materials to use in case of Symmetric/Asymmetric client usage

camel.component.aws-s3.useEncryption.name: camel.component.aws-s3.useEncryption
camel.component.aws-s3.useEncryption.description: Define if encryption must be used or not

camel.component.aws-s3.bridgeErrorHandle.name: camel.component.aws-s3.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.aws-s3.bridgeErrorHandle.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.aws-s3.deleteAfterRead.name: camel.component.aws-s3.deleteAfterRead
camel.component.aws-s3.deleteAfterRead.description: Delete objects from S3 after they have been retrieved. The delete is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs, the object is not deleted. If this option is false, then the same objects will be retrieve over and over again on the polls. Therefore you need to use the Idempotent Consumer EIP in the route to filter out duplicates. You can filter using the S3Constants#BUCKET_NAME and S3Constants#KEY headers, or only the S3Constants#KEY header.

camel.component.aws-s3.delimiter.name: camel.component.aws-s3.delimiter
camel.component.aws-s3.delimiter.description: The delimiter which is used in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

camel.component.aws-s3.fileName.name: camel.component.aws-s3.fileName
camel.component.aws-s3.fileName.description: To get the object from the bucket with the given file name

camel.component.aws-s3.includeBody.name: camel.component.aws-s3.includeBody
camel.component.aws-s3.includeBody.description: If it is true, the exchange body will be set to a stream to the contents of the file. If false, the headers will be set with the S3 object metadata, but the body will be null. This option is strongly related to autocloseBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the S3Object stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the S3Object stream automatically.

camel.component.aws-s3.prefix.name: camel.component.aws-s3.prefix
camel.component.aws-s3.prefix.description: The prefix which is used in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

camel.component.aws-s3.autocloseBody.name: camel.component.aws-s3.autocloseBody
camel.component.aws-s3.autocloseBody.description: If this option is true and includeBody is true, then the S3Object.close() method will be called on exchange completion. This option is strongly related to includeBody option. In case of setting includeBody to true and autocloseBody to false, it will be up to the caller to close the S3Object stream. Setting autocloseBody to true, will close the S3Object stream automatically.

camel.component.aws-s3.accelerateModeEna.name: camel.component.aws-s3.accelerateModeEnabled
camel.component.aws-s3.accelerateModeEna.description: Define if Accelerate Mode enabled is true or false

camel.component.aws-s3.chunkedEncodingDi.name: camel.component.aws-s3.chunkedEncodingDisabled
camel.component.aws-s3.chunkedEncodingDi.description: Define if disabled Chunked Encoding is true or false

camel.component.aws-s3.dualstackEnabled.name: camel.component.aws-s3.dualstackEnabled
camel.component.aws-s3.dualstackEnabled.description: Define if Dualstack enabled is true or false

camel.component.aws-s3.forceGlobalBucket.name: camel.component.aws-s3.forceGlobalBucketAccessEnabled
camel.component.aws-s3.forceGlobalBucket.description: Define if Force Global Bucket Access enabled is true or false

camel.component.aws-s3.payloadSigningEna.name: camel.component.aws-s3.payloadSigningEnabled
camel.component.aws-s3.payloadSigningEna.description: Define if Payload Signing enabled is true or false

camel.component.aws-s3.basicPropertyBind.name: camel.component.aws-s3.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.aws-s3.basicPropertyBind.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
